meanings.definition: The act or process of making a city or urban area.
meanings.sent1: The citification of the small town brought in more businesses and people.
meanings.sent2: After years of citification, the once rural area became a bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The citification of the village was so rapid that even the cows started wearing suits.
meanings.sent4: Her citification of the garden turned it into a concrete jungle of flowers and statues.
meanings.sent5: The citification of the neighborhood was so intense that even the birds wore tiny hats.

meanings.definition: The state of being urbanized or developed into a city.
meanings.sent1: The citification of the area led to taller buildings and more traffic.
meanings.sent2: She loved the citification of the town, with its bright lights and busy streets.
meanings.sent3: The citification of the countryside was so complete that even the trees wore bow ties.
meanings.sent4: His mind underwent a citification, transforming from a quiet village to a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The citification of the region brought with it a sense of excitement and opportunity.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being city-like or urban in nature.
meanings.sent1: The citification of the suburbia changed its quiet charm into a vibrant energy.
meanings.sent2: The citification of the park included adding more benches and streetlights.
meanings.sent3: The citification of the beach was so extreme that even the seagulls wore sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: Her style had a citification to it, with sleek lines and modern designs.
meanings.sent5: The citification of the town brought with it a sense of sophistication and diversity.
